text: The reason that the all-American boy prefers beauty to brains is that he can see better than he can think.
author: Farrah Fawcett

text: I love my beauty. It's not my fault.
author: Valentino Garavani

text: A sculptor wields The chisel, and the stricken marble grows To beauty.
author: William C. Bryant

text: Beauty is the result of having been through an experience all the way through to the end - therefore it has a poignancy. Beauty that is singular always comes from following an experience to the point where you can go no further.
author: Joan Chen
